question: The Trans Fats are considered risky for human health because they increases the risk of coronary heart disease by:
option1: Raising LDL cholesterol and decreasing HDL cholesterol
option2: Raising HDL cholesterol and decreasing LDL cholesterol
option3: Raising LDL as well as HDL Cholesterol
option4: Decreasing LDL as well as HDL Cholesterol
answer: Raising LDL cholesterol and decreasing HDL cholesterol
explanation: The consumption of trans fats increases the risk of coronary heart disease by raising levels of LDL cholesterol and lowering levels of “good” HDL cholesterol. Consumption of trans fat be reduced to trace amounts. Trans fats from partially hydrogenated oils are more harmful than naturally occurring oils.
